alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 3:01PM CDT until April 12 at 7:18AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria County. For the Guadalupe River...including Victoria...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River At Victoria. * WHEN...From late tonight to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Water flows into Saxet Lake Park starting to cover Fordyce Road, with portions of park inaccessible. Water crosses Fordyce Road at the large culvert between the lakes and main portion of Sexet Lake Park, covering some of the picnic area and roads. Water may be flowing under the US Business 59 East and West Relief Bridges. Water is on John F. Lee Drive in Riverside Park. On McCright Drive, water approaches the first parking lot, the field across the Texas Zoo, with baseball fields and stadium inaccessible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 6.52 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Saturday morning to a crest of 27.9 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.9 feet on 06/30/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts: Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Guadalupe River Victoria 21.0 6.2 Fri 11 am 25.2 27.7 27.9 24.6 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/crp.
